intro: Tibouchina lilacina, commonly known as the purple tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep purple. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Tibouchina lilacina is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
